page.title: 08PEEBLES LANDSCAPE & BUILDING
page.content: The river{Tweed}runs through the parish of{Peebles.}The{Tweed Valley} runs west to south east across the {Peebles}plateau (550 feet above sea level).To the north hills rise steeply Venlaw (1066ft),Meldon (1401ft)&Cardie (1361ft).North east lies Glentress Forest containing sites of Iron Age forts.Southwards the{D Block}reaches the lower slopes of Cademuir(1361ft). The A72 runs along{Tweed Valley,} & A703 goes northwards between Venlaw & Meldon through Valley of Eddleston Water the 20 miles to {Edinburgh. {Buildings}in Peebles High Street vary in style,but are mostly of whinstone & slate;many have informative plaques. Notable are{Cross Kirk ruins}(13thC), {Chambers Institute}(16thC){St Andrews {Tower}(12thC).Most{houses}are detached & semi villas of whinstone,mod. bungws & prefab.concrete council houses.
